text: Bill Mack (June 4, 1932 – July 31, 2020)Bill Mack, The Midnight Cowboy Retrieved 2018-04-18. was an American country music singer-songwriter, and radio host. He was born in Fort Worth, Texas. He was known for his songs "Blue" and "Drinking Champagne". He was also known for hosting radio shows on WBAP and XM Radio. Mack died of COVID-19 in Fort Worth on July 31, 2020 at the age of 88.Texas Radio's ‘Midnight Cowboy,' Country Songwriter Bill Mack Dies of COVID-19, Family Says ==References== Category:1932 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in Texas Category:American country singers Category:American singer-songwriters Category:American radio personalities Category:Singers from Texas Category:Writers from Fort Worth, Texas
title: Bill Mack (songwriter)
